Package br.com.armange.commons.thread.builder

Class AbstractThreadBuilder<S,​T,​U extends AbstractThreadBuilder<S,​T,​U>>

  • java.lang.Object
    • br.com.armange.commons.thread.builder.AbstractThreadBuilder<S,​T,​U>
  • Type Parameters:
    S - the type of the object resulting from the execution of the thread.
    T - Execution type. Runnable, Callable.
    U - Builder. The Builder extending AbstractThreadBuilder
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    AbstractTimingThreadBuilder, CommonCallableThreadBuilder, CommonRunnableThreadBuilder
    public abstract class AbstractThreadBuilder<S,​T,​U extends AbstractThreadBuilder<S,​T,​U>>
extends java.lang.Object
    Abstraction for thread builders that simplify, and provide some additional features(below) to the thread implementation.
    • Uncaught exception consumer
    • After execute consumer
    Since:
    2020-06-22 V1.1.0 (JDK 1.8)

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class Description
      protected static class  AbstractThreadBuilder.ExecutionType
      Class that enumerates the types of thread implementations that are supported by this builder.

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      protected void consumesFuture​(java.util.concurrent.Future<S> future)
      If the thread is of type Callable, it stores the thread result in an ExecutorResult instance and applies this result to the respective consumer.
      protected void createExecutorAndRunThread()
      Creates the thread executor (if necessary) and starts the thread.
      protected U getSelf()  
      protected java.util.concurrent.ThreadFactory getThreadFactory()  
      protected <F extends java.util.concurrent.Future<S>>
      java.util.function.BiConsumer<java.lang.Runnable,​java.lang.Throwable>      		 handleException​(br.com.armange.commons.thread.builder.Holder<F> futureHolder)
      Returns a lambda that handles exceptions caught on the thread.
      If the thread has not been canceled and there are no exceptions, and if there is a consumer for the thread's result, it will be executed.
      If the thread has thrown an exception, and if the thread has not been configured to silence exceptions, it will be handled according to the exception's consumer (if configured previously).
      protected void newExecutorResultIfNull()
      Creates a new ExecutorResult if necessary.
      protected void newExecutorServiceIfNull()
      Creates the thread executor (if necessary).
      protected void requireExecutionNonNull()
      Throws NullPointerException if it has no thread execution implementation.
      protected void runThread()
      Creates the thread executor (if necessary) and starts the thread.
      U setAfterExecuteConsumer​(java.util.function.BiConsumer<java.lang.Runnable,​java.lang.Throwable> afterExecuteConsumer)
      Sets the consumer to be called after thread execution.
      protected U setExecution​(T execution)
      Sets the thread execution.
      U setSilentInterruption​(boolean flag)
      Sets the thread-silent-interrupting-flag.
      When this flag is true, exceptions caught on the thread will only be logged, and will not be handled in any way.
      U setThreadNameSupplier​(java.util.function.Supplier<java.lang.String> threadNameSupplier)
      Sets the thread name supplier.
      U setThreadPrioritySupplier​(java.util.function.IntSupplier threadPrioritySupplier)
      Sets the thread priority supplier.
      protected U setThreadResultConsumer​(java.util.function.Consumer<S> threadResultConsumer)
      Sets the thread result consumer.
      After the thread execution, the result obtained will be consumed by this consumer.

      Creates the thread executor (if necessary) and starts the thread.

      • AbstractThreadBuilder

        protected AbstractThreadBuilder​(int corePoolSize)
        Constructs an abstract thread builder.
        Parameters:
        corePoolSize - the number of threads to keep in the pool, even if they are idle, unless allowCoreThreadTimeOut is set.

      • setThreadNameSupplier

        public U setThreadNameSupplier​(java.util.function.Supplier<java.lang.String> threadNameSupplier)
        Sets the thread name supplier. The thread factory will consume this supplier to generate a thread name before return a new thread.
        Parameters:
        threadNameSupplier - the thread name supplier.
        Returns:
        the current thread builder.

      • setSilentInterruption

        public U setSilentInterruption​(boolean flag)
        Sets the thread-silent-interrupting-flag.
        When this flag is true, exceptions caught on the thread will only be logged, and will not be handled in any way.
        Parameters:
        flag - true if the Interruption/Cancellation exceptions should be ignored.
        Returns:
        the current thread builder.
        See Also:
        Future.cancel(boolean), CancellationException, InterruptedException

      • setThreadResultConsumer

        Sets the thread result consumer.
        After the thread execution, the result obtained will be consumed by this consumer.
        Parameters:
        threadResultConsumer - the thread result consumer.
        Returns:
        the current thread builder.

      • submit

        protected java.util.concurrent.Future<S> submit()

      • handleException

        protected <F extends java.util.concurrent.Future<S>> java.util.function.BiConsumer<java.lang.Runnable,​java.lang.Throwable> handleException​(br.com.armange.commons.thread.builder.Holder<F> futureHolder)
        Returns a lambda that handles exceptions caught on the thread.
        If the thread has not been canceled and there are no exceptions, and if there is a consumer for the thread's result, it will be executed.
        If the thread has thrown an exception, and if the thread has not been configured to silence exceptions, it will be handled according to the exception's consumer (if configured previously).
        Type Parameters:
        F - the type of the object resulting from the execution of the thread.
        Parameters:
        futureHolder - the thread's Future object, encapsulated by a Holder object.
        Returns:
        a consumer for exceptions caught within threads.
        See Also:
        Holder, Future, setSilentInterruption(boolean)

      • consumesFuture

        protected void consumesFuture​(java.util.concurrent.Future<S> future)
                       throws java.lang.InterruptedException,
                              java.util.concurrent.ExecutionException
        If the thread is of type Callable, it stores the thread result in an ExecutorResult instance and applies this result to the respective consumer. If it is a Runnable thread, it just calls the get method of the Future object.
        Parameters:
        future - the thread Future object.
        Throws:
        java.lang.InterruptedException - if the thread was interrupted.
        java.util.concurrent.ExecutionException - if the thread fails.

      • newExecutorResultIfNull

        protected void newExecutorResultIfNull()
        Creates a new ExecutorResult if necessary.
